SEARCH
Package com.mimecast.robin.sasl

Class DovecotUserLookupNative

java.lang.Object
com.mimecast.robin.sasl.DovecotUserLookupNative
All Implemented Interfaces:
AutoCloseable
public class DovecotUserLookupNative extends Object implements AutoCloseable
DovecotUserLookupNative is a UNIX domain socket client for performing user existence lookups against a Dovecot authentication user database (auth-userdb) service using native Java UNIX domain sockets.

This class provides the main user lookup operation:

  • validate() - Check if a given username exists for a particular service

The implementation communicates with Dovecot's auth-userdb socket using the lightweight Dovecot auth client protocol. It sends a USER query and inspects the response to determine whether the user exists. Unlike full authentication (performed by DovecotSaslAuthNative), this lookup does not verify passwords; it only confirms presence and returns basic metadata (which can be extended in future if needed).

Protocol sequence (Dovecot auth client protocol v1.0):

  1. Client sends: 
    VERSION\t1\t0
  2. Client sends: 
    USER\t<id>\t<username>\tservice=<service>
  3. Server responds success: 
    USER\t<id> ...
  4. Server responds failure: 
    NOTFOUND\t<id> ...

Thread Safety: This class is NOT thread-safe. Each thread performing user lookup should create its own instance. Request identifiers (requestIdCounter) are unique per instance, but socket I/O is unsynchronized and must not be shared across threads.

Requirements:

  • Java 16 or higher (native UNIX domain sockets)
  • Unix/Linux OS (AF_UNIX socket support)
  • File system permission to access the Dovecot auth-userdb socket
  • Dovecot authentication service running with userdb access enabled

Usage Example: 

 Path userdbSocket = Paths.get("/var/run/dovecot/auth-userdb");
 try (DovecotUserLookupNative lookup = new DovecotUserLookupNative(userdbSocket)) {
     boolean exists = lookup.validate("user@example.com", "smtp");
     if (exists) {
         // proceed with authentication flow
     }
 }

Failure Handling: If the socket cannot be initialized (e.g. missing file, permission denied), the streams will be null and validate() will log an error and return false. Callers may wish to differentiate between "user not found" and "infrastructure failure" by monitoring logs.

Resource Management: Use try-with-resources or explicitly call close() to ensure that the underlying SocketChannel and streams are released promptly.

Extensibility: Future enhancements could parse additional fields from successful USER responses (quota, home directory, uid/gid, etc.) and expose them via a richer result object instead of a boolean.

  • Constructor Details

    • DovecotUserLookupNative

      public DovecotUserLookupNative(Path socketPath)
      Constructs a new DovecotUserLookupNative client and immediately attempts socket initialization. If initialization fails, the instance remains usable for close() but validate() will return false and log an error.
      Parameters:
      socketPath - Path to the auth-userdb socket (e.g. /var/run/dovecot/auth-userdb).

  • Method Details

    • initSocket

      void initSocket()
      Initializes the UNIX domain socket connection. Reads and logs any initial welcome banner once. Errors are caught broadly to avoid propagating unchecked exceptions to callers.

    • readWelcomeOnce

      private void readWelcomeOnce() throws IOException
      Reads a one-time welcome banner (if provided by Dovecot) and logs it for diagnostic purposes. Silently returns if no data is available.
      Throws:
      IOException

    • validate

      public boolean validate(String username, String service) throws IOException
      Validates (looks up) whether a user exists for a given service context.

      Sends a USER request and expects either USER (success) or NOTFOUND (failure) response. Currently returns a boolean; future versions may expose richer metadata.

      Parameters:
      username - User identifier to look up (e.g. user@example.com)
      service - Service context (e.g. smtp, imap) for policy-specific userdb rules.
      Returns:
      true if found (response starts with USER\t), false otherwise or if socket uninitialized.
      Throws:
      IOException - If an I/O error occurs while sending or receiving.

    • buildUserRequest

      private String buildUserRequest(String username, String service, long requestId)
      Builds a protocol-compliant USER request.

    • exchangeSingle

      private String exchangeSingle(String request) throws IOException
      Performs a single request/response round-trip for user lookup. Response is trimmed and logged.
      Throws:
      IOException

    • logDebug

      private void logDebug(String message, String phase)
      Logs multi-line protocol messages for debugging clarity.

    • close

      public void close()
      Closes the socket channel and associated streams, swallowing and logging any exceptions.
      Specified by:
      close in interface AutoCloseable
